title: No handshake. First debate adapts to Covid-19
A  'huge' virus surge could be on the horizon this fall
description:
• Tracking Covid-19: World nears one million deaths
• John King: These states are trending in the wrong direction

title: Muslim disqualified from high school volleyball match for wearing hijab
description: A Tennessee high school athlete was disqualified from a volleyball match for wearing a hijab, prompting calls for a statewide rule change.

title: Brian Stelter: This is among the most important stories of the past 5 years
description: The New York Times is reporting that it has obtained tax-return data going back over two decades for President Donald Trump, and alleges that in 2016 the President paid only $750 in income tax. CNN's Brian Stelter reports how the Times was able to legally access and verify the financial documents.

title: NFL legend Joe Montana stops kidnapping, police say
description: Legendary NFL quarterback Joe Montana and his wife confronted a woman suspected of trying to kidnap their grandchild Saturday, according to the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department.

title: No debate handshake for Biden, Trump. First presidential showdown adapts to Covid-19
description:
• Analysis: The Great Debate is here!
• Chris Wallace won't fact check Trump and Biden during the debate
• Here's how the candidates are preparing for the first presidential debate

title: M. Night Shyamalan reveals title and poster for upcoming movie
description: Director M. Night Shyamalan announced on Saturday the beginning of filming for his new movie titled "Old."

title: Two female coaches and a female official make NFL history
description: For the first time in the NFL's history, three women were on the gridiron Sunday in an official capacity during a regular-season game.

title: Adele shows off her silly side in birthday post for Nicole Richie
description: The perfect birthday post doesn't exi... Well, this one comes close.

title: 'John Lewis: Good Trouble:' Six life lessons from a civil rights legend
description: When filmmaker Dawn Porter began work on her documentary about the life of Rep. John Lewis, she knew she wanted to find a way to bring the revered congressman out of the pages of history books and into the full scope of his humanity.

title: Maryland to be first state to ban foam food service products
description: This week Maryland will become the first state in the US to ban the use of foam containers for carryout.

title: Jaime Vardy hits hat trick, Leicester City scores five as it thrashes Manchester City
description: Jamie Vardy scored a hat trick as Leicester City thrashed Manchester City 5-2 in the Premier League at the Etihad Stadium on Sunday.

title: Cockroaches, porn and a bloody pig mask: How eBay harassed bloggers
description: One of the most explosive Silicon Valley scandals of all time was a poorly run, easily discovered scheme inspired by a 1980s teen comedy, conducted by a company long past its heyday to harass a mom and pop blog.

title: Pelosi on why Trump is in a 'hurry' to confirm Barrett
description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said Sunday that President Donald Trump is in a "hurry" to confirm his Supreme Court nominee so that the conservative jurist can participate in a highly consequential Obamacare case the court is set to hear days after the election.

title: Remote work could spell doom for your favorite dry cleaner and lunch spot
description: Many Americans have been working from home since the pandemic started. But the shift to remote working could cause massive problems for the jobs and economy that have long relied on bustling offices and crowded business districts.

title: Teenager Jannik Sinner shocks 11th seed David Goffin in French Open first round
description: Teenager Jannik Sinner stunned 11th seed David Goffin in the first round of the French Open, beating the Belgian in straight sets on the opening day of the Grand Slam.

title: Swiss voters clearly reject curbs on EU immigration
description: Swiss voters overwhelmingly rejected on Sunday a right-wing party's attempt to scrap a pact allowing the free movement of people from the European Union, opting for stability amid the economic uncertainty caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Canadian boy rescued by police using night vision from a helicopter
description: Police in Ontario, Canada, used a helicopter, night vision technology and canine teams to find a 6-year-old special needs boy who went missing in a forest near his house.

title: Fareed Zakaria: How Donald Trump could lose and still win
description: CNN's Fareed Zakaria's discusses President Trump's failure to commit to a peaceful transfer of power if he loses the election in November and how he could use other branches of the government to retain his position.

title: How Trump's base appeals have backfired
Ivanka Trump adds campaign surrogate to portfolio
description: Ivanka Trump has combined her role as presidential adviser with that of in-demand campaign asset and fundraiser. Much like her father President Donald Trump, Ivanka Trump is of late mingling her two jobs, using trips that highlight her policy portfolio to deliver campaign messaging in strategically selected battleground states.

title: Graham: Senate committee will approve Barrett on October 22
description: Senate Judiciary Chairman Lindsey Graham said Sunday that the committee will approve Amy Coney Barrett's nomination to the Supreme Court on October 22, setting up a full Senate vote to send her to the high court by the end of the month.

title: Donald Trump's biggest challenge comes on Tuesday
description: Harold Wilson led Britain as prime minister for much of the 1960s and a shorter stint in the 1970s. Reputed to be a favorite of Queen Elizabeth II, the pipe-smoking Labour Party leader was a character in the most recent season of "The Crown." Wilson is usually credited with saying, "A week is a long time in politics."

title: Trump says the economy is booming. He's right -- but you don't feel it
description: President Donald Trump touts the economy's quick recovery as evidence of his administration's success. He's not wrong, but it's not the full picture.

title: Barrett's debut shows she will be a tough adversary for Democrats
Barrett selection draws attention to small religious group
description: • Analysis: How Trump's base appeals have backfired

title: Valtteri Bottas wins Russian GP after Lewis Hamilton is handed 10-second penalty
description: Valtteri Bottas won his second Formula One race of the 2020 season, easing to victory at the Russian Grand Prix after teammate Lewis Hamilton was hampered by two separate five-second penalties.

title: Trump's court pick made it clear how challenging it will be for Democrats to vilify her as a frightening figure
description: By nominating Judge Amy Coney Barrett to the Supreme Court, President Donald Trump took the first step Saturday toward solidifying a 6-3 conservative majority on the high court, a shift that could usher in sweeping changes to health care, as well as abortion, voting and gun rights. But the moment also served as an overture to female voters as Trump tries to address a historic gender gap in the polls.

title: Trump's appeal to base backfires
description:
• Analysis: Why Joe Biden's lead is different than Hillary Clinton's
• Analysis: This would be Biden's first foreign policy challenge if he were to win the election
• Some young activists aren't excited about Biden-Harris ticket. Here's why
• Opinion: Trump to face his biggest challenge

title: He lost his brother to Covid-19. Twelve days later, he died, too
description: Nicholas Gismondi was in the hospital when he found out his older brother, Ralph, had died from the coronavirus April 5.

title: Trump has stacked the federal bench, but he's not winning many election court battles
description: President Donald Trump stacked the federal judiciary long before nominating his third Supreme Court justice. So far, that hasn't helped him gain an advantage in 2020 voting nearly as much as he might have liked.

title: Tatiana Calderon calls for equal opportunities in motorsport after completing Le Mans 24 Hours
description: Racing driver Tatiana Calderon has called for more equality in motorsport after completing this year's Le Mans 24 Hours.

title: Dozens held after fourth night of protests over Breonna Taylor
Man finds 9-carat diamond at Crater of Diamonds State Park
description: Persistence pays.

title: The grim, disturbing truth behind British country estates
description: Grand buildings replete with turrets, picture windows and kitchen gardens. Perfectly manicured lawns. And hundreds of rooms stuffed with antiques and objet d'arts from across the globe.

title: A pandemic upended their communities, so these teen inventors built apps to make life easier
description: Riya Shah walked into her high school without knowing it would be her last day in person.

title: Science shows watching cute animals is good for your health
description: You knew watching videos of puppies and kittens felt good but now there's data to back that feeling.

title: 'Racial slurs' bring Covid-19 survey to a halt
description: A door-to-door Covid-19 survey in Minnesota has been halted after team members reported receiving racial and ethnic slurs in the city of Eitzen, according to state health officials, but the city denies the claims.

title: Analyst: Double standards define Trump administration
description: CNN national security analyst Samantha Vinograd weighs in on President Trump's unfounded attacks on mail-in voting and refusal to commit to a peaceful transition of power.

title: Trump is stealing China's playbook to deal with TikTok
description: The race to keep TikTok operating in the United States has turned into a saga of intricate dealmaking and political flattery.

title: Democrats launch case against Trump's nominee
description: Democrats on Saturday night launched their case against federal Judge Amy Coney Barrett, President Donald Trump's Supreme Court nominee, saying support for her confirmation was equivalent to a vote to end the Affordable Care Act.
